meanings.definition: A metal block that closes the rear end of a gun barrel
meanings.sent1: The breechblock sealed the gun barrel tightly.
meanings.sent2: The soldier carefully cleaned the breechblock of the rifle.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorn in the breechblock.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a breechblock, blocking out any distractions.
meanings.sent5: The shiny breechblock gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To block or obstruct the breech of a gun
meanings.sent1: They breechblock the cannon before the battle.
meanings.sent2: Please don't breechblock the rifle with dirt.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to breechblock the dog's path to the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter breechblocked any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The fallen tree breechblocked the road, causing a detour.
